title: How to Make a Depth Charge Cocktail

steps.headline: Prepare the orange to rim the glass.
steps.description: Take an orange and cut it in half, then cut it in half again. Cut a wedge from one half. Wipe the edge of the Collins glass with the wedge.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the sugar onto the saucer.
steps.description: Tip the orange rimmed Collins glass upside down and dip the wet rim right into the sugar. Turn the glass around to coat the rim in sugar. Lift up and check that there is sufficient sugar adhering to the rim.

steps.headline: Measure and pour the chilled beer into the Collins glass.
steps.description: Pour in 150 ml / 6 fl oz, or enough to fill until the glass is two-thirds full.

steps.headline: Measure and pour the vodka into the shot glass.
steps.description: Fill the glass to the top with vodka.

steps.headline: Pick up the full shot glass and drop it carefully into the Collins glass of beer.
steps.description: All you have to do now is sit back and enjoy your depth charge!

text: Prepare the orange to rim the glass. Take an orange and cut it in half, then cut it in half again. Cut a wedge from one half. Wipe the edge of the Collins glass with the wedge. Sprinkle the sugar onto the saucer. Tip the orange rimmed Collins glass upside down and dip the wet rim right into the sugar. Turn the glass around to coat the rim in sugar. Lift up and check that there is sufficient sugar adhering to the rim. Measure and pour the chilled beer into the Collins glass. Pour in 150 ml / 6 fl oz, or enough to fill until the glass is two-thirds full. Measure and pour the vodka into the shot glass. Fill the glass to the top with vodka. Pick up the full shot glass and drop it carefully into the Collins glass of beer. All you have to do now is sit back and enjoy your depth charge! Finished.
